assetIdentification.assetDescription: Control cabin climate through IVI system

cybersecurityProperties.description: Ensures that HVAC control commands cannot be maliciously modified or spoofed
Ensures that climate control functionality remains available to legitimate users

assessmentReferences.damageScenarioSummary: Unintended extreme heating causing driver distraction
assessmentReferences.threatScenarioSummary: Spoofed HVAC temperature command via CAN bus

riskTreatment.justification: Medium risk level warrants implementation of security controls

securityControls.description: Implement message authentication code (MAC) for HVAC control commands
securityControls.implementation: Add HMAC to all temperature control messages with vehicle-specific keys
securityControls.expectedRiskReduction: Reduces attack feasibility from High (2) to Low (1)

securityControls.description: Add plausibility checks for temperature commands
securityControls.implementation: Validate temperature commands against feasible operating ranges (16°C to 30°C)
securityControls.expectedRiskReduction: Reduces impact from Moderate (2) to Low (1)

securityControls.description: Implement rate limiting for temperature changes
securityControls.implementation: Limit the rate at which temperature can change to 2°C per minute
securityControls.expectedRiskReduction: Further reduces impact by preventing rapid temperature fluctuations

residualRisk.justification: Implemented controls significantly reduce risk to acceptable level

testCases.description: Verify MAC implementation prevents message injection
testCases.procedureSummary: Attempt to inject spoofed temperature control messages with and without valid MAC
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: System rejects messages with invalid MAC

testCases.procedureSummary: Attempt to send temperature commands outside valid range
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: System rejects or caps temperature values outside 16°C to 30°C range

testCases.procedureSummary: Send rapid temperature change commands and verify max rate of change
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: System limits temperature change to 2°C per minute

assessmentReferences.damageScenarioSummary: Loss of windshield defogger functionality in critical conditions
assessmentReferences.threatScenarioSummary: Denial of Service attack on HVAC defogger function

riskTreatment.justification: Medium risk level warrants implementation of security controls

securityControls.description: Implement message authentication for defogger commands
securityControls.implementation: Add HMAC to all defogger control messages with vehicle-specific keys
securityControls.expectedRiskReduction: Reduces attack feasibility from Medium (1) to Low (0)

securityControls.description: Implement redundant activation path for critical defogger function
securityControls.implementation: Create separate communication channel for critical defogging commands
securityControls.expectedRiskReduction: Reduces impact from High (3) to Moderate (2)

securityControls.description: Implement automatic defogger activation based on humidity sensors
securityControls.implementation: Add direct connection between humidity sensors and defogger function
securityControls.expectedRiskReduction: Adds defense-in-depth protection independent of IVI commands

residualRisk.justification: Implemented controls reduce risk to acceptable level through multiple layers of protection

testCases.procedureSummary: Attempt to inject spoofed defogger control messages with and without valid MAC
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: System rejects messages with invalid MAC

testCases.procedureSummary: Block primary communication path and attempt defogger activation through secondary path
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: Defogger activates despite primary path being blocked

testCases.procedureSummary: Simulate high humidity conditions and check defogger activation
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: Defogger activates automatically in response to high humidity

assessmentReferences.damageScenarioSummary: HVAC system rapid oscillation causing driver distraction
assessmentReferences.threatScenarioSummary: Rapid oscillation attack on HVAC system

riskTreatment.justification: Medium risk level warrants implementation of security controls

securityControls.description: Implement command rate limiting for HVAC functions
securityControls.implementation: Limit the frequency and rate of change for temperature and fan speed commands
securityControls.expectedRiskReduction: Reduces impact from Moderate (2) to Low (1)

securityControls.description: Implement anomaly detection for command sequences
securityControls.implementation: Monitor and flag abnormal patterns of HVAC commands
securityControls.expectedRiskReduction: Reduces attack feasibility from Very High (3) to Medium (1)

securityControls.description: Implement gradual transition for temperature changes
securityControls.implementation: Ensure temperature changes occur gradually even if rapid commands are received
securityControls.expectedRiskReduction: Further reduces impact by eliminating sudden changes

residualRisk.justification: Implemented controls reduce risk to acceptable level

testCases.procedureSummary: Send rapid sequence of HVAC commands and verify response
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: System throttles commands to acceptable rate

testCases.procedureSummary: Send abnormal pattern of temperature oscillation commands
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: System detects and flags anomalous command pattern

testCases.procedureSummary: Send command to change temperature rapidly and verify actual rate of change
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: System implements gradual temperature transition regardless of command timing

relatedRequirements.description: The IVI system shall limit HVAC temperature requests to feasible operating ranges
The IVI system shall authenticate all HVAC control messages using message authentication code
The IVI system shall implement message authentication for all TEMP_Control_Command messages using vehicle-specific keys
The IVI system shall transmit the DEFOG_Command signal with value "ACTIVATE" when the defog icon is tapped on the touchscreen
The IVI system shall maintain HVAC functionality after experiencing up to 10 consecutive error events in the CAN communication
The IVI system shall implement redundant validation for temperature values (16°C to 30°C)

contentSummary: Asset: Function: Control cabin climate through IVI system. Cyber‑security properties: Integrity and Availability. Three risk assessments: RA-HVAC-01 (Spoofed temperature commands) with Medium risk level, RA-HVAC-02 (Defogger DoS) with Medium risk level, RA-HVAC-03 (Rapid oscillation) with Medium risk level. Security controls include message authentication, plausibility checks, rate limiting, redundant activation paths, and anomaly detection.
